seqEasyFunctions 0.1.0
  • Reference

    Generate a list of normalized matrices from BigWig files over genomic regions.

    matList.Rd

    This function takes forward and reverse strand BigWig files and a list of genomic region sets, then returns a list of normalized matrices representing signal intensities over those regions. It supports flexible control over binning, strand handling, normalization mode, smoothing, and how the matrix represents target regions.

    matList(
  bwf,
  bwr,
  names,
  grl,
  wins = list(Gene = 10),
  mode = "coverage",
  output = "norm.matrix",
  strand = "rev",
  smooth = FALSE,
  extend = 0,
  w,
  include_target = TRUE,
  target_ratio = 0.5,
  k = 10,
  keep
)

    Arguments

    bwf

    A list of rtracklayer::BigWigFile objects for forward strand data (e.g., output of importBWlist).

    bwr

    A list of rtracklayer::BigWigFile objects for reverse strand data.

    names

    A character vector specifying the names to assign to the resulting list of matrices.

    grl

    A GRangesList where each element defines a set of genomic regions (e.g., genes, TSSs).

    wins

    A named list specifying the number of bins (windows) for each region type in grl. If multiple entries are provided, features are assumed to be combined.

    mode

    Character string specifying the normalization mode for normalizeToMatrix, such as "coverage" or "mean".

    output

    Output format: either "norm.matrix" (default) to return normalizedMatrix objects, or "matrix" to return base R matrices.

    strand

    Strand specificity: "rev" (default) for reverse alignment, "for" for forward, or "no" to ignore strand.

    smooth

    Logical; if TRUE, applies smoothing in normalizeToMatrix.

    extend

    Integer; number of base pairs to extend around each region.

    w

    Optional integer; smoothing window size (used when smooth = TRUE).

    include_target

    Logical; whether to include the target region in the matrix.

    target_ratio

    Numeric between 0 and 1; controls the fraction of the matrix allocated to the target region.

    k

    Integer; number of bins for the matrix (used only if wins has length 1).

    keep

    (Unused) Optional parameter placeholder for future development.

    Value

    A named list of matrices, either as EnrichedHeatmap::normalizedMatrix objects or base R numeric matrices, depending on the output parameter.

    Examples

    if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Load BigWig files and genomic regions
forward_bw <- importBWlist(c("sample1.f.bw", "sample2.f.bw"), c("sample1", "sample2"))
reverse_bw <- importBWlist(c("sample1.r.bw", "sample2.r.bw"), c("sample1", "sample2"))

gene_grl <- GRangesList(
  gene1 = GRanges("chr1", IRanges(1000, 2000), strand = "+", name = "gene1_a"),
  gene2 = GRanges("chr1", IRanges(3000, 4000), strand = "-", name = "gene2_b")
)

# Create normalized matrix list with 20 bins
matList(
  bwf = forward_bw,
  bwr = reverse_bw,
  names = c("sample1", "sample2"),
  grl = gene_grl,
  wins = list("Gene" = 20)
)
} # }
